summary: Password-gated romantic Brain Test–style puzzle game (DPB) with EXACTLY 100 handcrafted portrait levels, permanent progress saving, per-level win images + unique Love/Promise letters, plus hidden hints and a skip-level option; sample levels 1–3 are implemented, while most remaining levels still need full authored/interactive implementations (now protected against accidental auto-wins).

existing_features.title: Password-gated entry (exact password)
existing_features.description: Blocks all game UI until the user enters the exact password "dikshubhagat"; incorrect password shows a non-shaming error and stays on the password screen.

existing_features.title: Post-password loading screen and intro text screen
existing_features.description: After correct password entry, shows a loading screen for a few seconds and then displays the exact intro text: "Now you are entering in world of love and joy from bunny" before entering gameplay.

existing_features.title: Core screen flow (Password → Loading → Intro → Gameplay → Win/Lose)
existing_features.description: Implements the full app flow between password gate, loading, intro, level play, win screen (next level), and lose screen (retry).

existing_features.title: Progress persistence (local) with resume from last unlocked level
existing_features.description: Locally persists cleared/unlocked progress and resumes from the last unlocked level on reopen.

existing_features.title: Reusable level/puzzle framework with allowed mechanics
existing_features.description: Defines a reusable level structure (instruction + interactive objects + trick solution + win/fail) using permitted interaction mechanics (tap/drag/long press/multi-touch/hold+drag/timing/UI manipulation).

existing_features.title: Win screen with per-level deterministic image + unique Love/Promise letters
existing_features.description: Win screen includes fade-in, deterministic per-level win image mapping, unique Love Letter (2–4 lines) and Promise Letter (1–2 lines), plus Next Level button.

existing_features.title: Lose screen with soft shake, cute image, and randomized comforting messages
existing_features.description: Lose screen shows a soft shake animation, a cute illustration, and rotates randomized comforting/teasing (non-shaming) messages with retry.

existing_features.title: Sample gameplay implemented end-to-end for Levels 1–3
existing_features.description: Level 1: heart runs away; solution requires tapping instruction text. Level 2: drag sun down to make it night. Level 3: long-press to open letter. Includes win/fail logic, win/lose screens, and progress saving.

existing_features.title: Deterministic win-image asset mapping and uploaded images integration
existing_features.description: Maps uploaded/static win images to levels deterministically via code/data so win screens use attached assets in a documented, repeatable mapping.

existing_features.title: Cohesive romantic minimal visual theme (portrait frame)
existing_features.description: Applies a consistent romantic/minimal UI styling and portrait-first layout frame with gentle animations (fade/slide/scale).

existing_features.title: Hidden per-level hint system (opt-in reveal)
existing_features.description: Adds per-level hint content that is hidden by default and only revealed when the player taps a "See hint" control during gameplay.

existing_features.title: Skip Level option (advance without solving)
existing_features.description: Adds a Skip Level button that advances the player to the next level without solving the current one while keeping overall flow and progress behavior consistent.

existing_features.title: Fixed-puzzle level renderer uses proper React component rendering + fail-closed for unsupported puzzles
existing_features.description: Updates the fixed-puzzle wrapper so it renders as a proper React component (ensuring hooks/state/UI render reliably) and removes/disabled the generic fallback "Solve" button that previously triggered an unintended immediate win for unsupported solution types; missing implementations now surface clearly instead of silently winning.

existing_features.title: Events hub + event detail screens (romantic memories content)
existing_features.description: Adds an Events Hub screen and Event Detail screen with authored romantic event content and generated event photos, integrated into the React app navigation.

existing_features.title: Alternate "Promises100" game module with separate level configs and win/lose content
existing_features.description: Adds a parallel Promises100 game module under `frontend/src/game/promises100/` with its own level config registry, Promises100Level renderer, and dedicated winLetters/loseMessages content, enabling an alternate level-pack/content set alongside the main DPB levels.

existing_features.title: When the user starts Event 1 (gameId: "default") or Event 4 (gameId: "promises-100"), ensure gameplay always shows a visible "Skip" button that allows the user to skip the current level and advance progress to the next level (except on the final level where skipping is disabled).

new_feature_requests.summary: Core game: Unity 2D portrait Brain Test–style puzzle game with EXACTLY 100 fixed (non-random) levels and romantic/clever minimal tone
Initial delivery: provide full architecture, implement Level Manager + save system, UI flow, and fully implement sample levels 1–3
Create the core game architecture for a Brain Test–style puzzle game with EXACTLY 100 fixed (non-random) levels, portrait-first layout, and a minimal, clever, romantic tone (not childish).

Produce a complete authored content plan for all 100 levels that follows the fixed difficulty distribution (1–10, 11–20, …, 91–100) and includes, for each level: instruction text, objects involved, the hidden trick solution description, win condition, fail condition, plus a unique Love Letter and Promise Letter. Use English for all user-facing text in the app.
Implement Levels 4–100 with full interactive puzzle UI (2–6 objects, trick solution, clear win/fail) matching the quality/structure of Levels 1–3; remove any "level is coming" placeholders

Rewrite/update all Win-screen Love Letters and Promise Letters to be highly specific/personalized using provided relationship details (Dikshita/“chiuuu”, Bunny/“chotu”, likes: sleep, momos, Aditya Roy Kapoor, Galaxy chocolates, Netflix & chill, badminton; family names), while keeping lose messages unchanged

Implement complete solving interfaces in the fixed-puzzle framework for all solution types used by Levels 8–100 in `frontend/src/game/levels/impl/levelConfigs.ts`, matching the quality and interaction style of Levels 1–3 (clear objects, clear interaction, win/lose behavior).
Add a visible Skip button in Event 1 and Event 4 gameplay so users can skip the current level and advance to the next level if they can’t solve it.

architectural_notes: Exactly 100 handcrafted levels; no infinite/random levels; avoid repeated logic bugs
Progress persistence required: cleared levels permanently saved (PlayerPrefs/local) and resume from last unlocked on app reopen
Visual/audio direction: clean soft colors, cute but not childish; smooth animations (fade/slide/scale); no loud cartoon sounds
Win screen per level must show a unique attached image + unique Love Letter and Promise Letter; Next Level button
Lose screen uses soft shake + cute image + randomized comforting messages
Implementation uses a React/Vite frontend with a Motoko backend template (not Unity/C#).
Level implementation is component-based (Level001–Level003) with a shared level play screen and per-level win/lose routing.
Deterministic mapping tables exist for win images and per-level win letters (Love/Promise) plus a shared lose-message pool.
ICP/Internet Identity and canister actor hooks/scaffolding added (useInternetIdentity/useActor/useQueries) alongside Motoko authorization/access-control modules.
Project includes an ICP deployable build-template (Dockerfile, icp.yaml, deploy scripts) plus shadcn/ui scaffolding and image resize/prune pipeline scripts for consistent UI + asset handling.
known_issues: Tech stack/platform mismatch vs original Unity 2D Android/iOS requirement (current implementation is React/Motoko template).
Only Levels 1–3 are fully implemented; remaining levels/content plan for 4–100 not yet authored/implemented.
Most levels beyond 1–3 still require full authored interactive puzzle implementations (objects, interactions, win/fail) even if configs/content exist.
